description:
Minor code issues found by Clang.

Mostly that "extern const ... = ...;" is not legal.
You need two lines to make a non-static const declaration.

Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=45502

messages.text:
http://codereview.chromium.org/1739005/diff/1/2
File chrome/browser/gtk/gtk_theme_provider.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/1739005/diff/1/2#newcode291
chrome/browser/gtk/gtk_theme_provider.cc:291: const int kHeight = 20;
These are needed to make the "unsigned char data" declaration below happy.

LGTM

http://codereview.chromium.org/1739005/diff/1/3
File chrome/browser/sync/syncable/directory_backing_store.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/1739005/diff/1/3#newcode42
chrome/browser/sync/syncable/directory_backing_store.cc:42: const int32 kCurrentDBVersion = 70;
This fix is fine, although my preference would be to just move the const to the header file.  I'm not a big fan of re'declaring something.

http://codereview.chromium.org/1739005/diff/1/5
File chrome/tools/build/make_version_cc.py (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/1739005/diff/1/5#newcode23
chrome/tools/build/make_version_cc.py:23: extern const char kChromeVersion[];  // Give it non-static linkage.
I don't think we need this declaration, do we?  Shouldn't we just '#include "chrome/common/chrome_constants.h"'?

subject: Minor code issues found by Clang.
